            VERIFY all characters are Traditional forms
            CHECK for Simplified character intrusion
          END IF
        
        CORRECT any inconsistencies
      END FOR
    </STEP_1_CHARACTER_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_2_MEASURE_WORD_VARIANT_MATCHING>
      VERIFY measure words match character variant:
        Simplified text: 个, 台, 条
        Traditional text: 個, 臺, 條
      
      CORRECT if mismatch
    </STEP_2_MEASURE_WORD_VARIANT_MATCHING>
    
    <STEP_3_PUNCTUATION_VALIDATION>
      Chinese uses specific punctuation:
        Full stop: 。 (not .)
        Comma: 、(enumeration) or ，(standard)
        Quotation marks: 「」or『』(Traditional) / ""（Simplified common）
      
      VERIFY proper punctuation for variant
    </STEP_3_PUNCTUATION_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_4_OUTPUT>
      RETURN validated_chinese[] to AGENT_128
    </STEP_4_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <5ms per term
    Critical: Variant consistency 100%
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_127_CHINESE_FORMAT_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_128_CHINESE_MEASURE_WORD_HANDLER>
  <MISSION>Apply Chinese measure words appropriately</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR terms used with numbers:
      
      STRUCTURE: Number + Measure_Word + Noun
      
      EXAMPLE:
        Simplified: 三个气压缸 (three [classifier] pneumatic cylinders)
        Traditional: 三個氣壓缸
      
      INSERT appropriate measure word from glossary
      ENSURE variant matches (个/個, 台/臺, etc.)
    
    RETURN to AGENT_129
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_128_CHINESE_MEASURE_WORD_HANDLER>

<AGENT_129_CHINESE_COMPOUND_HANDLER>
  <MISSION>Handle Chinese compound term formation</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    Chinese technical terms typically multi-character compounds
    Written continuously (no spaces)
    
    MAINTAIN compound structure from glossary
    PRESERVE character order exactly
    NO spaces within compound
    
    EXAMPLE:
      气压缸 (pneumatic cylinder - 3 characters, no spaces)
      电磁阀 (solenoid valve - 3 characters, no spaces)
    
    RETURN to AGENT_130
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_129_CHINESE_COMPOUND_HANDLER>

<AGENT_130_CHINESE_QUALITY_CHECKER>
  <MISSION>Final Chinese quality verification</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VERIFY:
      - Correct variant used (CN vs TW)
      - Variant consistency throughout
      - Character integrity (no corruption)
      - Measure words appropriate and variant-matched
      - Compound structure proper
      - LOCKED terms exact character match
    
    CRITICAL CHECKS:
      NO mixing Simplified and Traditional in same text
      NO Japanese kanji intrusion
      ALL characters valid for chosen variant
    
    CALCULATE quality_score
    
    IF variant_mixing_detected:
      CRITICAL error
      FORCE correction
    END IF
    
    RETURN final_chinese_terms[] to USI Manager
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Quality threshold: ≥95%
    Variant purity: 100% required
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_130_CHINESE_QUALITY_CHECKER>

      RETURN enhanced_results[] to TIER 1 English agents
    </EXTENDED_LOOKUP>
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_131_ENGLISH_GLOSSARY_EXTENDED_LOOKUP>

================================================================================
AGENTS 141-145: GLOSSARY ORCHESTRATION AND MANAGEMENT
================================================================================

<AGENT_141_GLOSSARY_CONSISTENCY_MANAGER>
  <MISSION>Ensure consistency across all 17 languages in glossary</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR EACH glossary_entry (503 terms):
      
      VERIFY all 17 translations present
      CHECK semantic alignment across languages
      VALIDATE LOCKED status consistency
      ENSURE SEMANTIC_ID unique and propagated
      
      IF inconsistency_detected:
        LOG error
        FLAG for correction
      END IF
    
    MAINTAIN glossary integrity
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_141_GLOSSARY_CONSISTENCY_MANAGER>

<AGENT_142_GLOSSARY_UPDATE_COORDINATOR>
  <MISSION>Coordinate glossary updates across all language agents</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    WHEN new_term_added OR term_updated:
      
      PROPAGATE to all 17 language glossaries
      UPDATE all language-specific agents (66-145)
      VERIFY propagation complete
      VALIDATE consistency
      
      LOG update actions
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_142_GLOSSARY_UPDATE_COORDINATOR>

<AGENT_143_LOCKED_TERM_ENFORCER>
  <MISSION>Global enforcement of LOCKED term translations</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR EACH locked_term IN glossary:
      
      MONITOR usage across all 17 languages
      VERIFY exact translation used (no variations)
      OVERRIDE any AI-suggested alternatives
      
      IF violation_detected:
        FORCE glossary translation
        LOG enforcement action
        INCREMENT violation_counter
      END IF
    
    MAINTAIN 100% compliance for LOCKED terms
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_143_LOCKED_TERM_ENFORCER>

<AGENT_144_GLOSSARY_PERFORMANCE_MONITOR>
  <MISSION>Monitor glossary lookup performance across all agents</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    TRACK metrics:
      - Lookup speed per language
      - Match success rates
      - Confidence distributions
      - Cache hit rates
      
    OPTIMIZE:
      - Index structures
      - Cache strategies
      - Search algorithms
      
    REPORT performance statistics
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_144_GLOSSARY_PERFORMANCE_MONITOR>

<AGENT_145_GLOSSARY_QUALITY_AUDITOR>
  <MISSION>Audit glossary quality and completeness</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    PERIODIC audits:
      
      CHECK all 503 terms have 17 translations
      VERIFY translation quality scores
      VALIDATE technical accuracy
      REVIEW usage patterns
      IDENTIFY gaps or errors
      
      GENERATE audit reports
      RECOMMEND improvements
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_145_GLOSSARY_QUALITY_AUDITOR>

================================================================================
COMPLETE GLOSSARY DATABASE
503 TECHNICAL TERMS × 17 LANGUAGES = 8,551 TRANSLATIONS
================================================================================

<GLOSSARY_DATABASE_STRUCTURE>
  Total entries: 503 technical terms
  Languages: 17 (Japanese, English, German, French, Italian, Spanish-ES, Spanish-MX, Portuguese-BR, Czech, Polish, Turkish, Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian, Korean, Chinese-CN, Chinese-TW)
  
  Each entry contains:
    - SEMANTIC_ID (unique identifier)
    - Translations in all 17 languages
    - Language-specific metadata (gender, case, particles, etc.)
    - LOCKED status (boolean)
    - Domain category
    - Usage statistics
    - Confidence scores
</GLOSSARY_DATABASE_STRUCTURE>

<GLOSSARY_DATABASE>
  NOTE: Due to size constraints, showing representative sample entries.
  In actual deployment, all 503 terms fully specified.

  <TERM ID="CYL_001">
    <SEMANTIC_ID>CYL_001</SEMANTIC_ID>
    <CATEGORY>CYLINDER</CATEGORY>
    <LOCKED>false</LOCKED>
    
    <JAPANESE>空圧シリンダ</JAPANESE>
    <JAPANESE_READING>くうあつしりんだ</JAPANESE_READING>
    
    <ENGLISH>Pneumatic cylinder</ENGLISH>
    
    <GERMAN gender="masculine">
      <NOMINATIVE>Pneumatikzylinder</NOMINATIVE>
      <GENITIVE>Pneumatikzylinders</GENITIVE>
      <DATIVE>Pneumatikzylinder</DATIVE>
      <ACCUSATIVE>Pneumatikzylinder</ACCUSATIVE>
      <PLURAL_NOM>Pneumatikzylinder</PLURAL_NOM>
      <PLURAL_GEN>Pneumatikzylinder</PLURAL_GEN>
      <PLURAL_DAT>Pneumatikzylindern</PLURAL_DAT>
      <PLURAL_ACC>Pneumatikzylinder</PLURAL_ACC>
    </GERMAN>
    
    <FRENCH gender="masculine">
      <SINGULAR>vérin pneumatique</SINGULAR>
      <PLURAL>vérins pneumatiques</PLURAL>
    </FRENCH>

  </GLOSSARY_STATISTICS>

================================================================================
GLOSSARY ACCESS PROTOCOL
================================================================================

<GLOSSARY_ACCESS_PROTOCOL>
  <LOOKUP_METHODS>
    1. EXACT_MATCH: Search by exact term in any language
    2. SEMANTIC_ID: Direct lookup by SEMANTIC_ID
    3. CATEGORY: Retrieve all terms in category
    4. FUZZY_MATCH: Approximate matching with confidence scoring
    5. CROSS_LANGUAGE: Find term in one language, get all 17 translations
  </LOOKUP_METHODS>
  
  <INDEXING>
    Primary indexes:
      - SEMANTIC_ID (unique key)
      - Japanese terms (hash index)
      - English terms (hash index)
      - All other languages (hash indexes)
      - Category (B-tree index)
      - LOCKED status (bitmap index)
    
    Performance: O(1) average lookup time
    Memory: Entire glossary loaded in RAM (~80MB)
  </INDEXING>
  
  <CACHING>
    LRU cache for frequently accessed terms
    Cache size: 200 most recent lookups
    Hit rate: >85% in production
  </CACHING>
  
  <VERSIONING>
    Glossary version: V21.3.1
    Backward compatible with: V20.0
    Update mechanism: Atomic swap
    Rollback capability: Available
  </VERSIONING>
</GLOSSARY_ACCESS_PROTOCOL>

================================================================================
END OF TIER 2 PART 4
Agents 126-145: Chinese, English/Japanese Extensions, Orchestration
Complete Glossary Database: 503 terms × 17 languages
Lines: ~14,000
================================================================================

TIER 2 COMPLETE SUMMARY:
- Part 1: German, French, Italian, Spanish (Agents 66-85)
- Part 2: Portuguese, Czech, Polish, Turkish (Agents 86-105)
- Part 3: Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian, Korean (Agents 106-125)
- Part 4: Chinese, Extensions, Database (Agents 126-145)
- Total: 80 Glossary Agents + Complete Database
- Total Lines: ~56,000
================================================================================
================================================================================


================================================================================
TIER 3 - SEMANTIC AGENTS 146-182
================================================================================

USI17_V21.3.1 EXECUTABLE PROMPT - TIER 3: SEMANTIC EXTENSION SYSTEM
15 LANGUAGE SEMANTIC ENCODERS/DECODERS + VALIDATORS (AGENTS 146-182)
================================================================================

<TIER_3_OVERVIEW>
  <MISSION>
    Provide semantic-level translation for terms NOT in glossary
    Encode source language → 768-dimensional semantic vectors
    Decode semantic vectors → target language natural text
    Validate bidirectional consistency
  </MISSION>
  
  <ARCHITECTURE>
    15 Languages (excluding Japanese/English - handled in TIER 1):
      German, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Czech, Polish,
      Turkish, Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian, Korean, Chinese
    
    Each language has:
      - 1 Semantic Encoder (source → vector)
      - 1 Semantic Decoder (vector → target)
    
    Plus 7 Bidirectional Validators
    
    Total: 30 encoders/decoders + 7 validators + 5 coordinators = 42 agents
    But we use 37 agents (146-182) through optimization
  </ARCHITECTURE>
  
  <VECTOR_SPACE>
    768-dimensional semantic space (same as TIER 1)
    Language-agnostic meaning representation
    Enables any-to-any translation through pivot
  </VECTOR_SPACE>
</TIER_3_OVERVIEW>

================================================================================
AGENTS 146-147: GERMAN SEMANTIC PROCESSING
================================================================================

<AGENT_146_GERMAN_SEMANTIC_ENCODER>
  <MISSION>Convert German text to 768-dimensional semantic vectors</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_INPUT>
      RECEIVE: German text NOT found in glossary
      VERIFY: Glossary lookup already attempted (from TIER 2)
      INITIALIZE: encoding_process
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_INPUT>
    
    <STEP_2_LINGUISTIC_ANALYSIS>
      <MORPHOLOGICAL_DECOMPOSITION>
        German compound word handling:
          
          EXAMPLE: "Hochdruckpneumatikzylinder"
          DECOMPOSE:
            "Hoch" (high)
            + "druck" (pressure)
            + "Pneumatik" (pneumatic)
            + "zylinder" (cylinder)
          
          FOR EACH component:
            EXTRACT base meaning
            IDENTIFY relationship to other components
            BUILD compositional semantics
          END FOR
        
        IDENTIFY:
          - Root morphemes
          - Prefixes (un-, ver-, be-, etc.)
          - Suffixes (-ung, -heit, -keit, etc.)
          - Compound structure
      </MORPHOLOGICAL_DECOMPOSITION>
      
      <GRAMMATICAL_FEATURE_EXTRACTION>
        EXTRACT German-specific features:
          
          Gender: masculine/feminine/neuter
          Case: nominative/accusative/dative/genitive
          Number: singular/plural
          Definiteness: definite/indefinite
          
          Verb features:
            Tense: present/past/future
            Mood: indicative/subjunctive/imperative
            Voice: active/passive
            Aspect: perfective/imperfective
          
          Word order: V2 in main clause, verb-final in subordinate
      </GRAMMATICAL_FEATURE_EXTRACTION>
      
      <SEMANTIC_ROLE_IDENTIFICATION>
        IDENTIFY semantic roles in sentence:
          Agent: Who/what performs action
          Patient: Who/what affected by action
          Instrument: Means by which action performed
          Location: Where action occurs
          Time: When action occurs
        
        MAP to universal semantic roles (language-independent)
      </SEMANTIC_ROLE_IDENTIFICATION>
    </STEP_2_LINGUISTIC_ANALYSIS>
    
    <STEP_3_VECTOR_ENCODING>
      ENCODE into 768-dimensional vector:
        
        <DIMENSIONS_1_100_LEXICAL>
          MAP German words to semantic space:
            USE: German word embeddings
            ADJUST: For context
            WEIGHT: By importance
          
          Capture:
            - Concreteness (abstract ↔ concrete)
            - Animacy (inanimate ↔ animate)
            - Technical specificity
        </DIMENSIONS_1_100_LEXICAL>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_101_200_GRAMMATICAL>
          ENCODE German grammar:
            Gender markers → dimensions[101-110]
            Case markers → dimensions[111-130]
            Number → dimensions[131-140]
            Verb features → dimensions[141-180]
            Word order patterns → dimensions[181-200]
        </DIMENSIONS_101_200_GRAMMATICAL>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_201_300_DISCOURSE>
          ENCODE discourse features:
            Topic/focus marking
            Information structure
            Coherence relations
            Reference chains
        </DIMENSIONS_201_300_DISCOURSE>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_301_400_DOMAIN>
          ENCODE technical domain:
            Engineering terminology density
            Specification content
            Standards references
            Measurement data
        </DIMENSIONS_301_400_DOMAIN>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_401_500_CONTEXT>
          ENCODE contextual information:
            Sentence position
            Document structure
            Cross-reference data
        </DIMENSIONS_401_500_CONTEXT>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_501_600_SYNTAX>
          ENCODE German syntax:
            Compound structure
            Clause embedding
            Modifier relationships
        </DIMENSIONS_501_600_SYNTAX>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_601_700_SEMANTIC_ROLES>
          ENCODE predicate-argument structure:
            Agent/patient/theme encoding
            Peripheral arguments
            Secondary predicates
        </DIMENSIONS_601_700_SEMANTIC_ROLES>
        
        <DIMENSIONS_701_768_META>
          ENCODE translation metadata:
            Complexity score
            Ambiguity flags
            Confidence markers
            Quality indicators
        </DIMENSIONS_701_768_META>
        
        NORMALIZE to [-1, 1] range
        VALIDATE: No NaN/Inf values
      </STEP_3_VECTOR_ENCODING>
    
    <STEP_4_OUTPUT>
      CREATE semantic_package{
        source_text: german_input,
        semantic_vector: vector[768],
        confidence: encoding_confidence,
        linguistic_features: extracted_features,
        metadata: processing_info
      }
      
      RETURN to USI Manager for routing to decoder
    </STEP_4_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <80ms per sentence
    Vector quality: >0.92 semantic accuracy
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_146_GERMAN_SEMANTIC_ENCODER>

<AGENT_147_GERMAN_SEMANTIC_DECODER>
  <MISSION>Convert 768-dimensional semantic vectors to natural German text</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_VECTOR>
      RECEIVE: semantic_vector[768] from source language encoder
      VERIFY: Vector validity
      INITIALIZE: decoding_process
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_VECTOR>
    
    <STEP_2_SEMANTIC_INTERPRETATION>
      ANALYZE vector dimensions:
        
        EXTRACT core meaning (dimensions 1-100)
        IDENTIFY grammatical requirements (101-200)
        DETERMINE discourse context (201-300)
        ASSESS technical domain (301-400)
        
        BUILD conceptual structure for German realization
      </STEP_2_SEMANTIC_INTERPRETATION>
    
    <STEP_3_GERMAN_REALIZATION>
      <SELECT_VOCABULARY>
        CHOOSE appropriate German words:
          - Match semantic content
          - Fit technical register
          - Align with domain conventions
        
        PRIORITIZE:
          - Standard German technical terminology
          - Clear, unambiguous expressions
          - Natural collocations
      </SELECT_VOCABULARY>
      
      <APPLY_GERMAN_GRAMMAR>
        DETERMINE gender for all nouns:
          CHECK: Vector gender indicators
          APPLY: German gender assignment rules
          SELECT: der/die/das appropriately
        
        APPLY case system:
          ANALYZE: Grammatical function from vector
          SELECT: Proper case (nom/acc/dat/gen)
          DECLINE: Nouns, articles, adjectives
        
        SET number:
          DETERMINE: Singular vs plural from vector
          APPLY: Plural formation rules
        
        CONSTRUCT compounds:
          IF multi-component concept:
            BUILD German compound word
            APPLY linking elements (-s-, -e-, -n-, etc.)
            ENSURE: Correct compound structure
          END IF
      </APPLY_GERMAN_GRAMMAR>
      
      <CONSTRUCT_SENTENCE>
        APPLY German word order:
          Main clause: Subject-Verb-Object (V2 rule)
          Subordinate: Subject-Object-Verb (verb-final)
          
        PLACE verb in position 2 (main clause)
        POSITION separable prefix at clause end
        ARRANGE modifiers before nouns
        
        INSERT function words:
          Articles, prepositions, conjunctions
        
        APPLY punctuation:
          Commas for subordinate clauses
          Compound nouns without spaces
      </CONSTRUCT_SENTENCE>
    </STEP_3_GERMAN_REALIZATION>
    
    <STEP_4_QUALITY_ENHANCEMENT>
      VERIFY naturalness:
        CHECK: Idiomatic German
        AVOID: Literal translations
        ENSURE: Technical appropriateness
      
      VALIDATE grammar:
        CONFIRM: Gender agreement
        VERIFY: Case correctness
        CHECK: Compound structure
      
      OPTIMIZE readability
    </STEP_4_QUALITY_ENHANCEMENT>
    
    <STEP_5_OUTPUT>
      CREATE output_package{
        german_text: generated_text,
        confidence: decoding_confidence,
        alternatives: alternative_phrasings[],
        notes: generation_notes[]
      }
      
      RETURN to quality validator
    </STEP_5_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <100ms per sentence
    Quality: >90% naturalness, >95% grammatical accuracy
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_147_GERMAN_SEMANTIC_DECODER>

================================================================================
AGENTS 148-149: FRENCH SEMANTIC PROCESSING
================================================================================

<AGENT_148_FRENCH_SEMANTIC_ENCODER>
  <MISSION>Convert French text to semantic vectors</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    [Similar structure to German encoder]
    
    FRENCH-SPECIFIC features:
      - Elision handling (le/la → l')
      - Liaison contexts
      - Accent preservation
      - Gender system (2 genders)
      - Adjective placement
      - Partitive articles
      - Subjunctive mood
    
    ENCODE to 768-dimensional vector
    RETURN semantic_package
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_148_FRENCH_SEMANTIC_ENCODER>

<AGENT_149_FRENCH_SEMANTIC_DECODER>
  <MISSION>Convert semantic vectors to natural French text</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    [Similar structure to German decoder]
    
    FRENCH-SPECIFIC realization:
      - Gender agreement (masculine/feminine)
      - Number agreement
      - Adjective position (mostly after noun)
      - Elision application
      - Liaison where required
      - Accent marks correct
      - Article selection
      - Verb conjugation
    
    GENERATE natural French
    RETURN output_package
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_149_FRENCH_SEMANTIC_DECODER>

      - Gender system (2 genders)
      - Regular morphology

      - Pronoun dropping (pro-drop)
      - Clitic pronouns
      - Double consonants

      - Adjective declension

    GENERATE natural Czech
    RETURN output_package
  </ALGORITHM>

================================================================================
AGENTS 172-178: BIDIRECTIONAL VALIDATORS
================================================================================

<AGENT_172_ROMANCE_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate consistency across Romance languages (FR, IT, ES, PT)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR Romance_language_pairs:
      
      PERFORM round-trip validation:
        French → Vector → French
        Italian → Vector → Italian
        Spanish → Vector → Spanish
        Portuguese → Vector → Portuguese
      
      CROSS-VALIDATE:
        French ↔ Italian
        Spanish ↔ Portuguese
        French ↔ Spanish
        
      MEASURE semantic similarity
      
      IF similarity < 0.90:
        FLAG inconsistency
        ANALYZE divergence
        ATTEMPT correction
      END IF
    
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_172_ROMANCE_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_173_SLAVIC_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate consistency across Slavic languages (CZ, PL)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VALIDATE:
      Czech ↔ Polish consistency
      
    SPECIAL attention to:
      - 7-case systems
      - Diacritic accuracy
      - Aspect pairs
      - Gender systems
    
    VERIFY round-trip quality
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_173_SLAVIC_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_174_EAST_ASIAN_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate consistency across East Asian languages (KO, CN, JA)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VALIDATE:
      Korean ↔ Chinese
      Korean ↔ Japanese
      Chinese ↔ Japanese
    
    CHECK:
      - Sino-Korean/Kanji/Hanzi consistency
      - Measure word alignment
      - Semantic equivalence
    
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_174_EAST_ASIAN_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_175_SOUTHEAST_ASIAN_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate consistency across Southeast Asian languages (VI, TH, ID)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VALIDATE:
      Vietnamese ↔ Thai
      Vietnamese ↔ Indonesian
      Thai ↔ Indonesian
    
    SPECIAL attention:
      - Tone preservation (VI, TH)
      - Classifier consistency
      - Loanword handling
    
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_175_SOUTHEAST_ASIAN_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_176_GERMANIC_ROMANCE_BRIDGE_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate German ↔ Romance language transitions</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VALIDATE:
      German ↔ French
      German ↔ Italian
      German ↔ Spanish
      German ↔ Portuguese
    
    CHECK:
      - Compound decomposition ↔ multi-word phrases
      - Gender system mapping
      - Technical terminology alignment
    
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_176_GERMANIC_ROMANCE_BRIDGE_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_177_AGGLUTINATIVE_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate agglutinative languages (TR, ID, KO)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    VALIDATE:
      Turkish ↔ Indonesian
      Turkish ↔ Korean
      Indonesian ↔ Korean
    
    CHECK:
      - Suffix/particle handling
      - Morpheme boundaries
      - Harmony rules
    
    RETURN validation_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_177_AGGLUTINATIVE_LANGUAGE_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_178_GLOBAL_SEMANTIC_CONSISTENCY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate semantic consistency across all 15 languages in TIER 3</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR EACH language_pair:
      CALCULATE semantic_similarity
      
      IF similarity < threshold:
        IDENTIFY divergence_source
        LOG for review
      END IF
    END FOR
    
    ENSURE all languages converge to same meaning
    RETURN global_validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_178_GLOBAL_SEMANTIC_CONSISTENCY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENTS 179-182: TIER 3 COORDINATION AND OPTIMIZATION
================================================================================

<AGENT_179_SEMANTIC_ROUTING_COORDINATOR>
  <MISSION>Route between encoders and decoders efficiently</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    RECEIVE: Translation request (source_lang → target_lang)
    
    ROUTE:
      source_lang → Encoder(source)
      Encoder → semantic_vector[768]
      semantic_vector → Decoder(target)
      Decoder → target_text
    
    OPTIMIZE routing for parallel processing
    MANAGE queue priorities
    
    RETURN coordination_results
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_179_SEMANTIC_ROUTING_COORDINATOR>

<AGENT_180_VECTOR_SPACE_OPTIMIZER>
  <MISSION>Optimize semantic vector space for consistency</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    MONITOR vector quality across languages
    
    DETECT:
      - Semantic drift
      - Encoding inconsistencies
      - Decoding errors
    
    CALIBRATE:
      - Vector dimensions
      - Normalization parameters
      - Similarity thresholds
    
    MAINTAIN vector space integrity
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_180_VECTOR_SPACE_OPTIMIZER>

<AGENT_181_SEMANTIC_CONFIDENCE_SCORER>
  <MISSION>Calculate confidence scores for semantic translations</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FOR EACH semantic_translation:
      
      CALCULATE confidence based on:
        - Encoding quality (0-1)
        - Vector completeness (0-1)
        - Decoding naturalness (0-1)
        - Validation results (0-1)
        - Cross-language consistency (0-1)
      
      WEIGHTED AVERAGE:
        confidence = (encoding * 0.25 +
                     vector * 0.20 +
                     decoding * 0.25 +
                     validation * 0.20 +
                     consistency * 0.10)
      
      IF confidence < 0.75:
        FLAG for review
      END IF
      
      RETURN confidence_score
    </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_181_SEMANTIC_CONFIDENCE_SCORER>

<AGENT_182_TIER3_QUALITY_MANAGER>
  <MISSION>Overall quality management for TIER 3 semantic translations</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    AGGREGATE results from all 15 language pairs
    
    VERIFY:
      - All encoders functioning
      - All decoders producing quality output
      - Validators detecting errors
      - Confidence scores reasonable
    
    QUALITY GATES:
      IF semantic_translation_confidence < 0.75:
        ROUTE to human review
      END IF
      
      IF validation_fails:
        ATTEMPT re-encoding/decoding
        IF still_fails:
          ESCALATE to human translator
        END IF
      END IF
    
    MAINTAIN quality metrics:
      - Translation accuracy by language pair
      - Average confidence scores
      - Error rates
      - Processing times
    
    GENERATE quality reports
    RETURN quality_assessment
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_TARGETS>
    Semantic accuracy: >88% (lower than glossary due to ambiguity)
    Naturalness: >85%
    Confidence threshold: ≥0.75 for auto-acceptance
    Processing time: <200ms per sentence (full encode-decode cycle)
  </PERFORMANCE_TARGETS>
</AGENT_182_TIER3_QUALITY_MANAGER>

================================================================================
END OF TIER 3: SEMANTIC EXTENSION SYSTEM


================================================================================
TIER 4 - QUALITY AGENTS 183-199
================================================================================

USI17_V21.3.1 EXECUTABLE PROMPT - TIER 4: QUALITY VALIDATORS
17 LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC VALIDATORS + 2 CROSS-LANGUAGE VALIDATORS (AGENTS 183-199)
================================================================================

<TIER_4_OVERVIEW>
  <MISSION>
    Validate translation quality for all 17 languages
    Enforce language-specific rules and conventions
    Verify LOCKED term compliance
    Check technical accuracy
    Ensure naturalness and readability
  </MISSION>
  
  <ARCHITECTURE>
    17 Language-Specific Validators (one per language)
    2 Cross-Language Consistency Validators
    
    Each validator performs:
      - Grammar checking
      - Orthography validation
      - Technical terminology verification
      - Naturalness assessment
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Quality scoring
  </ARCHITECTURE>
  
  <QUALITY_THRESHOLDS>
    Excellent: ≥95%
    Good: ≥90%
    Acceptable: ≥85%
    Needs Review: 75-84%
    Reject: <75%
  </QUALITY_THRESHOLDS>
</TIER_4_OVERVIEW>

================================================================================
AGENT 183: JAPANESE QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_183_JAPANESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Japanese translation quality (extends TIER 1 Agent 6)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_TRANSLATION>
      RECEIVE: Japanese translation from decoder
      LOAD: Source text and semantic data
      INITIALIZE: validation_checks[]
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_TRANSLATION>
    
    <STEP_2_GRAMMAR_VALIDATION>
      <CHECK_PARTICLE_USAGE>
        VERIFY particles correct:
          が/は for subject/topic
          を for object
          に/へ for direction
          で for location/means
          の for possession
        
        CHECK particle agreement with noun endings
        VERIFY no particle stacking errors
        
        IF particle_error:
          MARK error location
          SUGGEST correction
          REDUCE grammar_score
        END IF
      </CHECK_PARTICLE_USAGE>
      
      <CHECK_VERB_FORMS>
        VERIFY:
          - Proper conjugation (ます/dictionary form)
          - Tense consistency
          - Aspect markers correct (ている, てある, etc.)
          - Negation proper (ない, ません)
          - Conditional forms (ば, たら, なら)
        
        CHECK polite vs casual consistency
        
        IF verb_error:
          LOG error
          REDUCE grammar_score
        END IF
      </CHECK_VERB_FORMS>
      
      <CHECK_HONORIFICS>
        VERIFY honorific consistency:
          - Level appropriate for context
          - No mixing casual/polite inappropriately
          - Respectful language where needed
          - Humble forms where appropriate
        
        IF honorific_inconsistency:
          FLAG for review
        END IF
      </CHECK_HONORIFICS>
    </STEP_2_GRAMMAR_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_3_ORTHOGRAPHY_VALIDATION>
      <CHECK_KANJI_USAGE>
        VERIFY:
          - Kanji appropriate for context
          - Readings correct (kun vs on)
          - Common vs rare kanji balance
          - No obsolete kanji unless needed
        
        CHECK kanji variant consistency
      </CHECK_KANJI_USAGE>
      
      <CHECK_KANA_USAGE>
        VERIFY:
          - Hiragana for particles
          - Katakana for foreign loanwords
          - No mixing errors
          - Proper okurigana
        
        CHECK small kana (っ, ゃ, ょ, etc.) correct
      </CHECK_KANA_USAGE>
      
      <CHECK_PUNCTUATION>
        VERIFY Japanese punctuation:
          。for full stop (not .)
          、for comma (not ,)
          「」for quotes
          ・ for middle dot
        
        CORRECT any Western punctuation intrusions
      </CHECK_PUNCTUATION>
    </STEP_3_ORTHOGRAPHY_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_4_TECHNICAL_ACCURACY>
      <VERIFY_GLOSSARY_TERMS>
        FOR EACH technical_term:
          CHECK if in glossary
          IF in_glossary:
            VERIFY exact translation used
            IF locked_term:
              VERIFY 100% compliance
              IF deviation_detected:
                CRITICAL_ERROR: "LOCKED term violation"
                FORCE glossary translation
              END IF
            END IF
          END IF
        END FOR
      </VERIFY_GLOSSARY_TERMS>
      
      <CHECK_TECHNICAL_CONSISTENCY>
        VERIFY:
          - Terminology consistent throughout
          - Specifications formatted correctly
          - Units of measurement proper
          - Standards references accurate
      </CHECK_TECHNICAL_CONSISTENCY>
    </STEP_4_TECHNICAL_ACCURACY>
    
    <STEP_5_NATURALNESS_ASSESSMENT>
      <CHECK_WORD_ORDER>
        VERIFY natural Japanese word order:
          - SOV structure
          - Topic-comment structure
          - Modifier before modified
        
        AVOID literal translations from English
      </CHECK_WORD_ORDER>
      
      <CHECK_COLLOCATION>
        VERIFY natural word combinations:
          - Verb-noun collocations proper
          - Adjective-noun pairs natural
          - No calques from other languages
        
        CHECK idiomatic expressions correct
      </CHECK_COLLOCATION>
      
      <CHECK_READABILITY>
        ASSESS:
          - Sentence length appropriate
          - Complexity suitable for technical text
          - Flow and coherence
        
        IF too_literal OR awkward:
          SUGGEST rephrasing
          REDUCE naturalness_score
        END IF
      </CHECK_READABILITY>
    </STEP_5_NATURALNESS_ASSESSMENT>
    
    <STEP_6_CALCULATE_SCORES>
      CALCULATE component scores:
        grammar_score = (correct_grammar / total_grammar_checks) * 100
        orthography_score = (correct_orthography / total_ortho_checks) * 100
        technical_score = (correct_terminology / total_terms) * 100
        naturalness_score = subjective_assessment (0-100)
      
      CALCULATE overall_quality:
        overall = (grammar * 0.30 +
                   orthography * 0.20 +
                   technical * 0.30 +
                   naturalness * 0.20)
      
      ASSIGN rating:
        IF overall ≥ 95: rating = "Excellent"
        ELSE IF overall ≥ 90: rating = "Good"
        ELSE IF overall ≥ 85: rating = "Acceptable"
        ELSE IF overall ≥ 75: rating = "Needs Review"
        ELSE: rating = "Reject"
      END IF
    </STEP_6_CALCULATE_SCORES>
    
    <STEP_7_OUTPUT>
      CREATE validation_report{
        language: "Japanese",
        overall_quality: score,
        rating: rating,
        component_scores: {
          grammar: grammar_score,
          orthography: orthography_score,
          technical: technical_score,
          naturalness: naturalness_score
        },
        errors_found: error_list[],
        warnings: warning_list[],
        locked_term_violations: violation_list[],
        recommendations: suggestion_list[],
        approval_status: approved/review/reject
      }
      
      RETURN validation_report
    </STEP_7_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <30ms per sentence
    Accuracy: >98% error detection
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_183_JAPANESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 184: ENGLISH QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_184_ENGLISH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate English translation quality (extends TIER 1 Agent 6)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      - Subject-verb agreement
      - Pronoun-antecedent agreement
      - Tense consistency
      - Article usage (a/an/the)
      - Preposition accuracy
      - Sentence structure
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <SPELLING_AND_STYLE>
      - US vs UK spelling consistency
      - Technical terminology spelling
      - Capitalization rules
      - Punctuation correctness
    </SPELLING_AND_STYLE>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary term compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Industry standard terminology
      - Specification formatting
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    <NATURALNESS>
      - Idiomatic English
      - No awkward constructions
      - Appropriate register
      - Clear and concise
    </NATURALNESS>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_184_ENGLISH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 185: GERMAN QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_185_GERMAN_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate German translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      <GENDER_AGREEMENT>
        VERIFY all gender agreements:
          - Articles match noun gender (der/die/das)
          - Adjective endings agree
          - Pronoun references correct
        
        CHECK: No gender errors
      </GENDER_AGREEMENT>
      
      <CASE_VALIDATION>
        VERIFY 4-case system correct:
          - Nominative for subjects
          - Accusative for direct objects
          - Dative for indirect objects
          - Genitive for possession
        
        CHECK: Prepositions govern correct cases
        VERIFY: Article declensions match case
      </CASE_VALIDATION>
      
      <VERB_POSITION>
        VERIFY German word order:
          - V2 in main clauses
          - Verb-final in subordinate clauses
          - Separable prefixes at end
        
        CHECK: No English word order intrusion
      </VERB_POSITION>
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
      - Noun capitalization (all nouns!)
      - ß vs ss usage correct
      - Umlaut usage (ä, ö, ü)
      - Compound spelling (no spaces)
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED terms enforced
      - Compound formation correct
      - Technical register appropriate
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    <NATURALNESS>
      - Natural German phrasing
      - Appropriate compounds
      - No literal translations
      - Technical style suitable
    </NATURALNESS>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_185_GERMAN_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

<AGENT_186_FRENCH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate French translation quality</MISSION>

    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      - Gender agreement (masculine/feminine)
      - Number agreement (singular/plural)
      - Adjective position (before/after noun)
      - Article selection (le/la/les, un/une/des)
      - Verb conjugation
      - Subjunctive usage
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
      - Accent marks (é, è, ê, ë, à, ù)
      - Cedilla (ç)
      - Elision (le → l', de → d')
      - Liaison contexts
      - Spacing before punctuation (: ; ! ?)
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Technical vocabulary correct
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    <NATURALNESS>
      - Natural French phrasing
      - Appropriate formality
      - No anglicisms unless standard
    </NATURALNESS>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_186_FRENCH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>

      - Cedilla (ç)
      - Tilde (ã, õ)
      - Circumflex (â, ê, ô)
      
      CRITICAL: All diacritics correct
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <BRAZILIAN_VARIANT>
      VERIFY Brazilian Portuguese (not European):
        - Brazilian vocabulary
        - Brazilian verb forms (você, not vós)
        - Modern spelling
    </BRAZILIAN_VARIANT>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores

  </ALGORITHM>

================================================================================
AGENT 190: CZECH QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_190_CZECH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Czech translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      <CASE_VALIDATION>
        VERIFY all 7 cases correct:
          1. Nominative
          2. Genitive
          3. Dative
          4. Accusative
          5. Vocative
          6. Locative
          7. Instrumental
        
        CHECK: Case matches grammatical function
        VERIFY: Prepositions govern correct cases
      </CASE_VALIDATION>
      
      <GENDER_AGREEMENT>
        VERIFY 3-gender system:
          - Masculine animate
          - Masculine inanimate
          - Feminine
          - Neuter
        
        CHECK: Adjectives agree in gender/number/case
      </GENDER_AGREEMENT>
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
      CRITICAL: Diacritic validation
        č, ď, ě, ň, ř, š, ť, ž, ů
        á, é, í, ó, ú, ý
      
      VERIFY: All diacritics present and correct
      
      IF diacritic_missing OR wrong:
        CRITICAL_ERROR: "Diacritics change meaning!"
        FORCE correction
      END IF
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Case declensions from glossary correct
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_190_CZECH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

      - Number agreement

    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>

      CRITICAL: Polish diacritics
        ą, ć, ę, ł, ń, ó, ś, ź, ż
      
      VERIFY: All diacritics correct
      CHECK: No confusion (ś vs ź vs ż)
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>

      - LOCKED term enforcement

================================================================================
AGENT 192: TURKISH QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_192_TURKISH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Turkish translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      <VOWEL_HARMONY>
        VERIFY vowel harmony in suffixes:
          - Front vowels: e, i, ö, ü
          - Back vowels: a, ı, o, u
        
        CHECK: Suffixes harmonize with root
        
        IF vowel_harmony_violation:
          CRITICAL_ERROR: "Vowel harmony broken"
          FORCE correction
        END IF
      </VOWEL_HARMONY>
      
      <CONSONANT_HARMONY>
        VERIFY consonant harmony:
          - Voicing assimilation correct
          - Consonant mutations proper
      </CONSONANT_HARMONY>
      
      <SUFFIX_ORDER>
        VERIFY suffix ordering:
          Root + Plural + Case + Possessive + Person
        
        CHECK: Order strictly maintained
      </SUFFIX_ORDER>
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
      CRITICAL: i/ı distinction
        - i → İ (dotted capital)
        - ı → I (dotless capital)
      
      VERIFY: Special letters correct (ç, ğ, ö, ş, ü)
      CHECK: i/ı never confused
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Suffix harmony correct
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_192_TURKISH_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 193: VIETNAMESE QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_193_VIETNAMESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Vietnamese translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <TONE_VALIDATION>
      CRITICAL: Tone mark verification
        6 tones: level, falling, rising, question, tumbling, heavy
      
      FOR EACH syllable:
        VERIFY: Tone mark present (except level tone)
        CHECK: Tone mark on correct vowel
        VALIDATE: Tone mark type correct
        
        IF tone_missing OR wrong:
          CRITICAL_ERROR: "Tones change meaning!"
          MARK for correction
        END IF
      END FOR
    </TONE_VALIDATION>
    
    <ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
      VERIFY diacritics:
        - Vowels: a, ă, â, e, ê, i, o, ô, ơ, u, ư, y
        - Tone marks: `, ´, ̉, ~, ̣
        - Combined: à, ả, ã, á, ạ, etc.
      
      CHECK: All diacritics present and positioned correctly
    </ORTHOGRAPHY_CHECKS>
    
    <SYLLABLE_STRUCTURE>
      VERIFY: Valid Vietnamese syllable structure
      CHECK: Spacing/hyphenation correct
      VALIDATE: Classifier usage
    </SYLLABLE_STRUCTURE>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement (with exact tones!)
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores (tone accuracy weighted heavily)
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_193_VIETNAMESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 194: THAI QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_194_THAI_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Thai translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <SCRIPT_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY: Thai script integrity
        - 44 consonants correct
        - Vowel symbols positioned correctly
        - Tone marks (่ ้ ๊ ๋) proper
      
      CHECK: No character corruption
      VALIDATE: Proper Unicode encoding
    </SCRIPT_VALIDATION>
    
    <TONE_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY: 5 tones correct
        - Mid (no mark)
        - Low (่)
        - Falling (้)
        - High (๊)
        - Rising (๋)
      
      CHECK: Tone marks match consonant class
    </TONE_VALIDATION>
    
    <WORD_BOUNDARIES>
      VERIFY: Proper word segmentation
      CHECK: No spaces within words
      VALIDATE: Spaces only between words/phrases
    </WORD_BOUNDARIES>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Classifier usage correct
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_194_THAI_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

      - Affix selection appropriate
      - Reduplication correct
      - Word order (SVO)
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <SPELLING_CHECKS>
      VERIFY: Modern spelling (EYD system)
        - Not archaic Dutch spellings
        - Consistent throughout
      
      CHECK: No spelling variants mixed
    </SPELLING_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement
      - Affixes applied correctly
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores

  </ALGORITHM>
