================================================================================
AGENT 196: KOREAN QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_196_KOREAN_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Korean translation quality</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <SCRIPT_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY: Hangul syllable blocks correct
        - Initial consonant (초성)
        - Medial vowel (중성)
        - Optional final consonant (종성)
      
      CHECK: All syllables structurally valid
      VALIDATE: No character corruption
    </SCRIPT_VALIDATION>
    
    <PARTICLE_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY particles correct:
        - Subject: 이/가 (after consonant/vowel)
        - Topic: 은/는 (after consonant/vowel)
        - Object: 을/를 (after consonant/vowel)
        - Possessive: 의
        - Direction: 로/으로
      
      CHECK: Particle selection matches final sound
      
      CRITICAL: Particle choice determines meaning
    </PARTICLE_VALIDATION>
    
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      - SOV word order
      - Honorific system appropriate
      - Verb endings correct
      - No particle stacking errors
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement (exact Hangul)
      - Compound spacing correct
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_196_KOREAN_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 197: CHINESE QUALITY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_197_CHINESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate Chinese translation quality (both Simplified and Traditional)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <VARIANT_VALIDATION>
      DETERMINE expected variant:
        - Simplified (CN) for mainland/Singapore
        - Traditional (TW) for Taiwan/Hong Kong
      
      VERIFY variant consistency:
        CHECK: NO mixing Simplified and Traditional
        
        IF variant_mixing:
          CRITICAL_ERROR: "Mixed CN/TW variants"
          FORCE correction to single variant
        END IF
      
      VALIDATE: All characters correct for chosen variant
    </VARIANT_VALIDATION>
    
    <CHARACTER_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY: All characters valid Chinese
      CHECK: No Japanese kanji intrusion
      VALIDATE: No character corruption
      ENSURE: Proper Unicode encoding
    </CHARACTER_VALIDATION>
    
    <GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
      - Measure word usage correct
      - Aspect markers appropriate
      - Word order (SVO)
      - Particle usage proper
    </GRAMMAR_CHECKS>
    
    <WORD_SEGMENTATION>
      VERIFY: No inappropriate spaces
      CHECK: Compounds written correctly (continuous)
    </WORD_SEGMENTATION>
    
    <TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      - Glossary compliance
      - LOCKED term enforcement (exact characters, both variants)
      - Measure words from glossary
    </TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    CALCULATE scores
    
    CRITICAL_CHECK:
      IF variant_purity < 100%:
        REJECT translation
      END IF
    
    RETURN validation_report
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_197_CHINESE_QUALITY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 198: CROSS-LANGUAGE TERMINOLOGY VALIDATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_198_CROSS_LANGUAGE_TERMINOLOGY_VALIDATOR>
  <MISSION>Validate terminology consistency across all 17 languages</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_COLLECT_TERMINOLOGY>
      FOR EACH language IN [all_17_languages]:
        EXTRACT technical terms from translation
        STORE with SEMANTIC_ID references
      END FOR
    </STEP_1_COLLECT_TERMINOLOGY>
    
    <STEP_2_CROSS_VALIDATE>
      FOR EACH SEMANTIC_ID:
        RETRIEVE translations from all 17 languages
        
        VERIFY consistency:
          - All languages use same SEMANTIC_ID
          - Glossary terms used consistently
          - LOCKED terms identical across languages
          - Domain categorization consistent
        
        IF inconsistency_detected:
          LOG discrepancy
          IDENTIFY source of divergence
          FLAG for correction
        END IF
      END FOR
    </STEP_2_CROSS_VALIDATE>
    
    <STEP_3_LOCKED_TERM_GLOBAL_CHECK>
      FOR EACH locked_term:
        VERIFY 100% compliance in ALL 17 languages
        
        IF ANY_violation:
          CRITICAL_ERROR: "LOCKED term violated"
          FORCE glossary translation in violating language
          LOG enforcement action
        END IF
      END FOR
    </STEP_3_LOCKED_TERM_GLOBAL_CHECK>
    
    <STEP_4_SEMANTIC_ALIGNMENT>
      CALCULATE semantic similarity across languages:
        
        FOR EACH language_pair:
          COMPARE semantic vectors
          MEASURE cosine_similarity
          
          IF similarity < 0.88:
            FLAG: "Potential semantic drift"
            RECOMMEND review
          END IF
        END FOR
    </STEP_4_SEMANTIC_ALIGNMENT>
    
    <STEP_5_OUTPUT>
      CREATE cross_language_report{
        terminology_consistency: score,
        locked_term_compliance: percentage,
        semantic_alignment: average_similarity,
        discrepancies: discrepancy_list[],
        violations: violation_list[],
        recommendations: recommendation_list[]
      }
      
      RETURN cross_language_report
    </STEP_5_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <100ms for full cross-language check
    Accuracy: 100% locked term detection
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_198_CROSS_LANGUAGE_TERMINOLOGY_VALIDATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 199: GLOBAL QUALITY ORCHESTRATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_199_GLOBAL_QUALITY_ORCHESTRATOR>
  <MISSION>Orchestrate all quality validation across entire translation system</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_COORDINATE_VALIDATORS>
      INITIALIZE all 17 language validators
      INITIALIZE 2 cross-language validators
      
      FOR EACH translation_task:
        ROUTE to appropriate language validator(s)
        COLLECT validation results
      END FOR
    </STEP_1_COORDINATE_VALIDATORS>
    
    <STEP_2_AGGREGATE_RESULTS>
      COLLECT results from:
        - All language-specific validators (183-197)
        - Cross-language validator (198)
      
      AGGREGATE quality scores:
        overall_translation_quality = AVERAGE(all_language_scores)
        terminology_consistency = cross_language_score
        locked_term_compliance = 100% OR violation
    </STEP_2_AGGREGATE_RESULTS>
    
    <STEP_3_QUALITY_GATES>
      APPLY quality thresholds:
        
        IF overall_quality ≥ 95:
          STATUS = "Excellent - Auto-approve"
          ACTION = Release to production
        
        ELSE IF overall_quality ≥ 90:
          STATUS = "Good - Auto-approve with logging"
          ACTION = Release with quality note
        
        ELSE IF overall_quality ≥ 85:
          STATUS = "Acceptable - Quick review recommended"
          ACTION = Release with review flag
        
        ELSE IF overall_quality ≥ 75:
          STATUS = "Needs Review - Hold for review"
          ACTION = Queue for human review
        
        ELSE:
          STATUS = "Reject - Retranslation required"
          ACTION = Return to translation pipeline
        END IF
        
        CRITICAL_OVERRIDE:
          IF locked_term_violation:
            STATUS = "Reject - LOCKED term violated"
            ACTION = Force retranslation with glossary enforcement
          END IF
    </STEP_3_QUALITY_GATES>
    
    <STEP_4_GENERATE_REPORTS>
      CREATE master_quality_report{
        translation_id: unique_id,
        source_language: source,
        target_language(s): targets[],
        overall_quality: score,
        status: status,
        action: action,
        
        language_scores: {
          japanese: score,
          english: score,
          german: score,
          [... all 17 languages]
        },
        
        validation_summary: {
          grammar_errors: count,
          orthography_errors: count,
          technical_errors: count,
          naturalness_issues: count,
          locked_violations: count
        },
        
        recommendations: recommendation_list[],
        required_corrections: correction_list[],
        
        processing_time: milliseconds,
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      STORE master_quality_report
    </STEP_4_GENERATE_REPORTS>
    
    <STEP_5_CONTINUOUS_IMPROVEMENT>
      ANALYZE quality patterns:
        - Common error types by language
        - Validator performance metrics
        - Quality trends over time
        - Locked term violation patterns
      
      GENERATE insights for system improvement
      UPDATE validator thresholds if needed
      
      REPORT to system administrators
    </STEP_5_CONTINUOUS_IMPROVEMENT>
    
    <STEP_6_OUTPUT>
      RETURN {
        master_quality_report: report,
        approval_status: status,
        action_required: action,
        corrected_translation: final_text (if corrections applied)
      }
    </STEP_6_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Target: <200ms total validation time (all languages)
    Throughput: >100 translations/second coordination
    Accuracy: 100% locked term violation detection
    Quality gate reliability: >99.5%
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_199_GLOBAL_QUALITY_ORCHESTRATOR>

================================================================================
END OF TIER 4: QUALITY VALIDATORS


================================================================================
TIER 5 - AUTONOMOUS AGENTS 200-210
================================================================================

USI17_V21.3.1 EXECUTABLE PROMPT - TIER 5: AUTONOMOUS EXPANSION SYSTEM
SELF-LEARNING GLOSSARY GROWTH (AGENTS 200-210)
================================================================================

<TIER_5_OVERVIEW>
  <MISSION>
    Autonomously discover, research, validate, and deploy new glossary terms
    Expand from 503 terms to unlimited coverage
    Maintain quality standards across all 17 languages
    Enable continuous improvement without human intervention
  </MISSION>
  
  <ARCHITECTURE>
    11 Agents operating in pipeline:
      1. Term Discovery (identify candidates)
      2. Multi-Language Research (find translations in all 17 languages)
      3. Semantic Vector Generation (create USI representations)
      4. Quality Assessment (validate accuracy)
      5. Confidence Scoring (calculate approval threshold)
      6. Auto-Approval Routing (≥95% auto-deploy, 85-94% quick review, <85% full review)
      7. Database Integration (add to glossary)
      8. Deployment Manager (activate in production)
      9. Usage Tracking (monitor performance)
      10. Feedback Learning (improve from corrections)
      11. System Optimizer (refine discovery algorithms)
  </ARCHITECTURE>
  
  <AUTO_APPROVAL_THRESHOLDS>
    ≥95% confidence: Auto-approve and deploy immediately
    85-94% confidence: Quick human review (5 min)
    70-84% confidence: Full human review (30 min)
    <70% confidence: Reject, return to research
  </AUTO_APPROVAL_THRESHOLDS>
  
  <SAFETY_MECHANISMS>
    - Multi-source verification required
    - Cross-language consistency checks
    - Domain expert validation (TIER 6)
    - LOCKED status only by human approval
    - Rollback capability for all changes
    - A/B testing for uncertain terms
  </SAFETY_MECHANISMS>
</TIER_5_OVERVIEW>

================================================================================
AGENT 200: TERM DISCOVERY ENGINE
================================================================================

<AGENT_200_TERM_DISCOVERY_ENGINE>
  <MISSION>Identify new technical terms not in current glossary (503 terms)</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_MONITORING_SOURCES>
      MONITOR translation requests for unknown terms:
        
        TRACK terms that:
          - Not found in glossary (confidence = 0.0)
          - Routed to TIER 3 semantic translation
          - Appear frequently (≥3 times in 30 days)
          - Technical in nature (domain-specific)
          - Used consistently across documents
        
        COLLECT candidate_terms[]
    </STEP_1_MONITORING_SOURCES>
    
    <STEP_2_FREQUENCY_ANALYSIS>
      FOR EACH candidate_term:
        
        CALCULATE metrics:
          usage_frequency = count_in_period / total_translations
          consistency_score = same_context_usage / total_usage
          technical_likelihood = domain_pattern_match_score
          
        PRIORITY_SCORE = (frequency * 0.4 +
                         consistency * 0.3 +
                         technical * 0.3)
        
        IF priority_score ≥ 0.70:
          MARK for research
          ADD to research_queue[]
        END IF
      END FOR
    </STEP_2_FREQUENCY_ANALYSIS>
    
    <STEP_3_DOMAIN_CATEGORIZATION>
      FOR EACH term IN research_queue[]:
        
        ANALYZE context to determine domain:
          - Pneumatics
          - Hydraulics
          - Electrical/Electronic
          - Mechanical
          - Sensors/Instrumentation
          - Control Systems
          - Materials
          - Safety
          - Quality Assurance
          - Manufacturing
          
        ASSIGN category
        IDENTIFY related_terms[]
      END FOR
    </STEP_3_DOMAIN_CATEGORIZATION>
    
    <STEP_4_DEDUPLICATION>
      CHECK for duplicates:
        - Same term different spellings
        - Synonyms
        - Regional variants
        - Already in glossary under different form
        
      MERGE duplicates
      PRESERVE highest priority variant
    </STEP_4_DEDUPLICATION>
    
    <STEP_5_PRIORITIZATION>
      RANK research_queue by:
        1. Usage frequency (higher = more important)
        2. Technical criticality (domain importance)
        3. Translation difficulty (complexity)
        4. User request patterns (demand)
        
      SORT queue: highest priority first
    </STEP_5_PRIORITIZATION>
    
    <STEP_6_OUTPUT>
      CREATE discovery_report{
        new_terms_discovered: count,
        research_queue: prioritized_terms[],
        domain_distribution: category_counts{},
        priority_rankings: rankings[],
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      SEND top_priority_terms to AGENT_201 (Multi-Language Research)
      
      RETURN discovery_report
    </STEP_6_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <DISCOVERY_RATE_TARGETS>
    Target: 50-100 new candidate terms per month
    Research capacity: 10-20 terms per day
    Auto-approval rate: 60-70% of researched terms
    Net glossary growth: 30-50 terms per month
  </DISCOVERY_RATE_TARGETS>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Discovery latency: <24 hours from 3rd occurrence
    False positive rate: <15% (non-technical terms flagged)
    Coverage increase: +10% glossary size per year
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_200_TERM_DISCOVERY_ENGINE>

================================================================================
AGENT 201: MULTI-LANGUAGE RESEARCH COORDINATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_201_MULTI_LANGUAGE_RESEARCH_COORDINATOR>
  <MISSION>Research new terms across all 17 languages simultaneously</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_TERM>
      RECEIVE: candidate_term from AGENT_200
      EXTRACT: source_language, term_text, domain, context
      INITIALIZE: research_data{} for all 17 languages
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_TERM>
    
    <STEP_2_PARALLEL_RESEARCH>
      FOR EACH language IN [JP, EN, DE, FR, IT, ES, ES-MX, PT, CZ, PL, TR, VI, TH, ID, KO, CN, TW]:
        
        LAUNCH parallel_research_task:
          
          <SEARCH_TECHNICAL_DICTIONARIES>
            QUERY specialized dictionaries:
              - Engineering dictionaries
              - Industry glossaries
              - Standards organization databases (ISO, JIS, DIN, etc.)
              - Manufacturer catalogs
              - Technical documentation archives
            
            SEARCH for term in target language
            COLLECT translation_candidates[]
          </SEARCH_TECHNICAL_DICTIONARIES>
          
          <WEB_RESEARCH>
            SEARCH authoritative sources:
              - Technical forums (language-specific)
              - Academic papers
              - Industry publications
              - Government standards documents
              - Professional associations
            
            EXTRACT potential_translations[]
            VERIFY source_credibility
          </WEB_RESEARCH>
          
          <CROSS_REFERENCE_VALIDATION>
            FOR EACH translation_candidate:
              
              VERIFY across multiple sources:
                REQUIRE: ≥3 independent confirmations
                
              ASSESS source_quality:
                Primary sources (standards, manufacturers): weight = 1.0
                Secondary sources (dictionaries): weight = 0.8
                Tertiary sources (forums, blogs): weight = 0.5
              
              CALCULATE candidate_confidence:
                confidence = (Σ(source_weight * source_reliability)) / source_count
              
              IF confidence ≥ 0.80:
                ACCEPT translation_candidate
                STORE with confidence score
              ELSE:
                CONTINUE searching
              END IF
            END FOR
          </CROSS_REFERENCE_VALIDATION>
          
          <EXTRACT_METADATA>
            FOR accepted_translation:
              
              EXTRACT language-specific metadata:
                
                IF language = German:
                  DETERMINE gender (masculine/feminine/neuter)
                  GENERATE all case forms
                  BUILD compound structure
                
                ELSE IF language = French/Italian/Spanish/Portuguese:
                  DETERMINE gender (masculine/feminine)
                  GENERATE plural forms
                  IDENTIFY adjective positioning
                
                ELSE IF language = Czech/Polish:
                  DETERMINE gender (3-4 categories)
                  GENERATE all 7 case forms (singular + plural)
                  VERIFY diacritics
                
                ELSE IF language = Turkish:
                  GENERATE case suffixes with vowel harmony
                  CREATE plural forms
                  VERIFY i/ı distinction
                
                ELSE IF language = Vietnamese:
                  VERIFY all tone marks
                  IDENTIFY classifier
                  CONFIRM syllable structure
                
                ELSE IF language = Thai:
                  VERIFY Thai script
                  CONFIRM tone marks
                  IDENTIFY classifier
                
                ELSE IF language = Korean:
                  VERIFY Hangul structure
                  DETERMINE particle requirements
                  CHECK Hanja equivalents
                
                ELSE IF language = Chinese:
                  GENERATE both Simplified and Traditional
                  VERIFY character variants
                  IDENTIFY measure word
                  CONFIRM pinyin
                
                [Additional languages handled similarly]
              END IF
              
              STORE metadata with translation
            END FOR
          </EXTRACT_METADATA>
        
        END parallel_research_task
      END FOR
      
      WAIT for all 17 language tasks to complete
    </STEP_2_PARALLEL_RESEARCH>
    
    <STEP_3_CONSOLIDATE_RESULTS>
      COLLECT results from all 17 languages
      
      VERIFY completeness:
        CHECK: All 17 languages have ≥1 candidate translation
        
        IF any_language_missing:
          EXTEND research for missing languages
          RETRY with alternative sources
          
          IF still_missing:
            REDUCE overall_confidence
            FLAG: "Incomplete language coverage"
          END IF
        END IF
    </STEP_3_CONSOLIDATE_RESULTS>
    
    <STEP_4_CROSS_LANGUAGE_CONSISTENCY>
      VALIDATE consistency across languages:
        
        FOR EACH language_pair:
          COMPARE semantic alignment
          CHECK technical equivalence
          VERIFY no contradictions
          
          IF inconsistency_detected:
            INVESTIGATE discrepancy
            RE-RESEARCH conflicting languages
            RESOLVE to single consistent meaning
          END IF
        END FOR
    </STEP_4_CROSS_LANGUAGE_CONSISTENCY>
    
    <STEP_5_GENERATE_SEMANTIC_ID>
      CREATE unique SEMANTIC_ID:
        FORMAT: [CATEGORY]_[SEQUENCE_NUMBER]
        EXAMPLE: "CYL_504", "VLV_089", "SNS_045"
        
      VERIFY: No collision with existing IDs
      ASSIGN to term_entry
    </STEP_5_GENERATE_SEMANTIC_ID>
    
    <STEP_6_OUTPUT>
      CREATE research_package{
        semantic_id: unique_id,
        source_term: original_term,
        domain: category,
        
        translations: {
          japanese: {term, reading, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          english: {term, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          german: {term, gender, cases, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          french: {term, gender, plural, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          italian: {term, gender, plural, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          spanish_es: {term, gender, plural, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          spanish_mx: {term, gender, plural, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          portuguese_br: {term, gender, plural, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          czech: {term, gender, cases, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          polish: {term, gender, cases, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          turkish: {term, cases, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          vietnamese: {term, tones, classifier, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          thai: {term, tones, classifier, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          indonesian: {term, affixes, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          korean: {term, particles, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          chinese_cn: {term, pinyin, measure_word, metadata, confidence, sources[]},
          chinese_tw: {term, pinyin, measure_word, metadata, confidence, sources[]}
        },
        
        research_quality: overall_confidence,
        source_count: total_sources_consulted,
        cross_language_consistency: consistency_score,
        research_time: milliseconds,
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      SEND research_package to AGENT_202 (Semantic Vector Generator)
      
      RETURN research_package
    </STEP_6_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <RESEARCH_QUALITY_REQUIREMENTS>
    Minimum sources per language: 3 independent sources
    Preferred sources per language: 5+ independent sources
    Source credibility threshold: ≥0.70 average
    Cross-language consistency: ≥0.85 required
    Metadata completeness: 100% for all languages
  </RESEARCH_QUALITY_REQUIREMENTS>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Research time per term: 2-5 minutes (parallel across 17 languages)
    Success rate: ≥90% (all 17 languages found)
    Source quality: ≥0.80 average credibility
    Accuracy: ≥95% (verified by human spot-checks)
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_201_MULTI_LANGUAGE_RESEARCH_COORDINATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 202: SEMANTIC VECTOR GENERATOR
================================================================================

<AGENT_202_SEMANTIC_VECTOR_GENERATOR>
  <MISSION>Generate 768-dimensional semantic vectors for new terms in all 17 languages</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_RESEARCH>
      RECEIVE: research_package from AGENT_201
      EXTRACT: translations for all 17 languages
      INITIALIZE: vector_generation_process
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_RESEARCH>
    
    <STEP_2_GENERATE_LANGUAGE_VECTORS>
      FOR EACH language IN all_17_languages:
        
        EXTRACT translation and metadata
        
        USE appropriate encoder (from TIER 1/TIER 3):
          IF language = Japanese: Use AGENT_2
          IF language = English: Use TIER 1 English encoder
          IF language IN [German, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Czech, Polish, Turkish, Vietnamese, Thai, Indonesian, Korean, Chinese]:
            Use corresponding TIER 3 encoder
          END IF
        
        GENERATE semantic_vector[768] for this language
        
        STORE language_vector
      END FOR
    </STEP_2_GENERATE_LANGUAGE_VECTORS>
    
    <STEP_3_VECTOR_ALIGNMENT>
      CALCULATE centroid vector:
        centroid[i] = AVERAGE(all_17_language_vectors[i]) for i in 1..768
      
      MEASURE alignment:
        FOR EACH language_vector:
          similarity = COSINE_SIMILARITY(language_vector, centroid)
          
          IF similarity < 0.85:
            FLAG: "Semantic divergence in [language]"
            INVESTIGATE translation accuracy
          END IF
          
          STORE alignment_score
        END FOR
      
      AVERAGE_ALIGNMENT = MEAN(all_alignment_scores)
    </STEP_3_VECTOR_ALIGNMENT>
    
    <STEP_4_CANONICAL_VECTOR>
      CREATE canonical_semantic_vector:
        
        METHOD 1 - Centroid (default):
          canonical = centroid_vector
          
        METHOD 2 - Weighted average (if quality varies):
          FOR i in 1..768:
            canonical[i] = Σ(language_vector[i] * language_confidence) / Σ(confidence)
          END FOR
        
        METHOD 3 - Consensus (if high agreement):
          IF average_alignment ≥ 0.95:
            canonical = median_vector (most central)
          END IF
        
        NORMALIZE to [-1, 1] range
        VALIDATE: No NaN/Inf values
    </STEP_4_CANONICAL_VECTOR>
    
    <STEP_5_QUALITY_VALIDATION>
      VERIFY vector quality:
        
        CHECK dimensional completeness:
          - All 768 dimensions populated
          - No zero-only dimensions
          - Reasonable distribution
        
        VERIFY semantic coherence:
          - Lexical dimensions (1-100) meaningful
          - Grammatical dimensions (101-200) appropriate
          - Domain dimensions (301-400) correctly set
        
        TEST round-trip accuracy:
          FOR sample_language:
            Vector → Decoder → Text
            Compare output with original translation
            MEASURE similarity
            
            IF similarity < 0.90:
              FLAG: "Vector quality concern"
              REVIEW encoding process
            END IF
          END FOR
    </STEP_5_QUALITY_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_6_OUTPUT>
      CREATE vector_package{
        semantic_id: term_id,
        canonical_vector: canonical[768],
        language_vectors: {
          japanese: vector[768],
          english: vector[768],
          [... all 17 languages]
        },
        alignment_scores: scores[],
        average_alignment: overall_alignment,
        vector_quality: quality_score,
        generation_method: method_used,
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      SEND vector_package to AGENT_203 (Quality Assessment)
      
      RETURN vector_package
    </STEP_6_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <VECTOR_QUALITY_THRESHOLDS>
    Excellent: average_alignment ≥ 0.95
    Good: average_alignment ≥ 0.90
    Acceptable: average_alignment ≥ 0.85
    Needs_Review: average_alignment 0.80-0.84
    Reject: average_alignment < 0.80
  </VECTOR_QUALITY_THRESHOLDS>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Generation time: <500ms (all 17 language vectors + canonical)
    Alignment quality: ≥0.92 average
    Round-trip accuracy: ≥0.93
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_202_SEMANTIC_VECTOR_GENERATOR>

================================================================================
AGENT 203: QUALITY ASSESSMENT ENGINE
================================================================================

<AGENT_203_QUALITY_ASSESSMENT_ENGINE>
  <MISSION>Comprehensively assess quality of new term candidate</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_MULTI_DIMENSIONAL_ASSESSMENT>
      EVALUATE across 5 dimensions:
        
        <DIMENSION_1_RESEARCH_QUALITY>
          ASSESS research thoroughness:
            source_count_score = MIN(source_count / 5, 1.0) * 100
            source_credibility_score = average_source_reliability * 100
            completeness_score = (languages_with_translations / 17) * 100
            
          research_quality = (source_count * 0.3 +
                             credibility * 0.4 +
                             completeness * 0.3)
        </DIMENSION_1_RESEARCH_QUALITY>
        
        <DIMENSION_2_TRANSLATION_ACCURACY>
          ASSESS translation correctness:
            cross_reference_score = multi_source_agreement * 100
            expert_validation_score = domain_expert_confirmation * 100
            consistency_score = cross_language_consistency * 100
            
          translation_accuracy = (cross_ref * 0.4 +
                                  expert * 0.3 +
                                  consistency * 0.3)
        </DIMENSION_2_TRANSLATION_ACCURACY>
        
        <DIMENSION_3_LINGUISTIC_QUALITY>
          ASSESS language-specific correctness:
            
            FOR EACH language:
              grammar_score = grammatical_correctness * 100
              orthography_score = spelling_diacritics_correct * 100
              metadata_score = (gender/case/tones_correct) * 100
              
              language_quality = (grammar * 0.4 +
                                 orthography * 0.3 +
                                 metadata * 0.3)
              
              STORE language_quality
            END FOR
            
            linguistic_quality = AVERAGE(all_language_qualities)
        </DIMENSION_3_LINGUISTIC_QUALITY>
        
        <DIMENSION_4_SEMANTIC_COHERENCE>
          ASSESS vector quality:
            vector_alignment_score = average_alignment * 100
            vector_completeness = dimensional_coverage * 100
            round_trip_score = encoding_decoding_accuracy * 100
            
          semantic_coherence = (alignment * 0.4 +
                               completeness * 0.3 +
                               round_trip * 0.3)
        </DIMENSION_4_SEMANTIC_COHERENCE>
        
        <DIMENSION_5_PRACTICAL_UTILITY>
          ASSESS usefulness:
            frequency_score = (usage_frequency / max_frequency) * 100
            criticality_score = domain_importance * 100
            uniqueness_score = fills_gap_in_glossary * 100
            
          practical_utility = (frequency * 0.4 +
                              criticality * 0.3 +
                              uniqueness * 0.3)
        </DIMENSION_5_PRACTICAL_UTILITY>
    </STEP_1_MULTI_DIMENSIONAL_ASSESSMENT>
    
    <STEP_2_CALCULATE_OVERALL_QUALITY>
      WEIGHTED AVERAGE of 5 dimensions:
        
        overall_quality = (research_quality * 0.25 +
                          translation_accuracy * 0.30 +
                          linguistic_quality * 0.20 +
                          semantic_coherence * 0.15 +
                          practical_utility * 0.10)
      
      NORMALIZE to 0-100 scale
    </STEP_2_CALCULATE_OVERALL_QUALITY>
    
    <STEP_3_IDENTIFY_ISSUES>
      FLAG potential problems:
        
        IF any_dimension < 70:
          IDENTIFY weak_dimension
          ANALYZE root_cause
          RECOMMEND improvement_action
        END IF
        
        CHECK for disqualifying issues:
          - Missing translations (any of 17 languages)
          - Semantic divergence (alignment < 0.80)
          - Source unreliability (credibility < 0.60)
          - Contradictory information across sources
          - Linguistic errors (critical diacritics, gender, etc.)
        
        IF disqualifying_issue:
          MARK: "Reject - requires reresearch"
          EXPLAIN reason
        END IF
    </STEP_3_IDENTIFY_ISSUES>
    
    <STEP_4_OUTPUT>
      CREATE quality_report{
        semantic_id: term_id,
        overall_quality_score: score (0-100),
        
        dimension_scores: {
          research_quality: score,
          translation_accuracy: score,
          linguistic_quality: score,
          semantic_coherence: score,
          practical_utility: score
        },
        
        language_breakdown: {
          japanese: language_score,
          english: language_score,
          [... all 17 languages]
        },
        
        issues_identified: issue_list[],
        disqualifying_issues: critical_issues[],
        recommendations: recommendation_list[],
        
        quality_rating: "Excellent" | "Good" | "Acceptable" | "Needs_Work" | "Reject",
        
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      SEND quality_report to AGENT_204 (Confidence Scorer)
      
      RETURN quality_report
    </STEP_4_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <QUALITY_RATING_SCALE>
    Excellent: ≥95 overall, all dimensions ≥90
    Good: ≥90 overall, all dimensions ≥85
    Acceptable: ≥85 overall, all dimensions ≥80
    Needs_Work: ≥75 overall, some dimensions <80
    Reject: <75 overall OR any disqualifying issue
  </QUALITY_RATING_SCALE>
</AGENT_203_QUALITY_ASSESSMENT_ENGINE>

================================================================================
AGENT 204: CONFIDENCE SCORER
================================================================================

<AGENT_204_CONFIDENCE_SCORER>
  <MISSION>Calculate final confidence score for auto-approval routing</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_AGGREGATE_INPUTS>
      COLLECT all quality metrics:
        - Research quality (from AGENT_201)
        - Vector alignment (from AGENT_202)
        - Overall quality (from AGENT_203)
        - Language-specific scores (all 17)
        - Source credibility
        - Cross-validation results
    </STEP_1_AGGREGATE_INPUTS>
    
    <STEP_2_CALCULATE_CONFIDENCE>
      FIVE-FACTOR CONFIDENCE MODEL:
        
        <FACTOR_1_SOURCE_RELIABILITY>
          source_confidence = (Σ(source_credibility * source_weight)) / total_sources
          WEIGHT: 0.25
        </FACTOR_1_SOURCE_RELIABILITY>
        
        <FACTOR_2_CROSS_VALIDATION>
          validation_confidence = multi_source_agreement_rate
          BOOST: +0.10 if ≥5 sources agree
          WEIGHT: 0.20
        </FACTOR_2_CROSS_VALIDATION>
        
        <FACTOR_3_LINGUISTIC_ACCURACY>
          linguistic_confidence = average_language_quality_score / 100
          PENALIZE: -0.05 per critical error (gender, case, tones)
          WEIGHT: 0.25
        </FACTOR_3_LINGUISTIC_ACCURACY>
        
        <FACTOR_4_SEMANTIC_ALIGNMENT>
          semantic_confidence = vector_alignment_score
          REQUIRE: ≥0.85 for consideration
          WEIGHT: 0.20
        </FACTOR_4_SEMANTIC_ALIGNMENT>
        
        <FACTOR_5_DOMAIN_VALIDATION>
          domain_confidence = domain_expert_verification_score
          IF expert_approved: confidence = 1.0
          IF expert_uncertain: confidence = 0.70
          IF no_expert_yet: confidence = 0.85 (default)
          WEIGHT: 0.10
        </FACTOR_5_DOMAIN_VALIDATION>
      
      CALCULATE final_confidence:
        final_confidence = (source * 0.25 +
                           validation * 0.20 +
                           linguistic * 0.25 +
                           semantic * 0.20 +
                           domain * 0.10)
      
      APPLY adjustments:
        IF all_17_languages_verified: BOOST +0.03
        IF usage_frequency_very_high: BOOST +0.02
        IF any_critical_error: PENALIZE -0.10
        IF source_count < 3_per_language: PENALIZE -0.05
      
      CLAMP to [0.0, 1.0] range
      CONVERT to percentage (0-100%)
    </STEP_2_CALCULATE_CONFIDENCE>
    
    <STEP_3_ROUTING_DECISION>
      DETERMINE approval_route based on confidence:
        
        IF final_confidence ≥ 0.95:
          route = "AUTO_APPROVE"
          action = "Deploy immediately to production glossary"
          review_required = false
          
        ELSE IF final_confidence ≥ 0.90:
          route = "QUICK_REVIEW"
          action = "5-minute human spot check, then deploy"
          review_required = true
          review_type = "quick"
          
        ELSE IF final_confidence ≥ 0.85:
          route = "STANDARD_REVIEW"
          action = "15-minute human review, validate key languages"
          review_required = true
          review_type = "standard"
          
        ELSE IF final_confidence ≥ 0.70:
          route = "FULL_REVIEW"
          action = "30-minute comprehensive human review"
          review_required = true
          review_type = "full"
          
        ELSE:
          route = "REJECT"
          action = "Return to research phase"
          review_required = false
        END IF
    </STEP_3_ROUTING_DECISION>
    
    <STEP_4_UNCERTAINTY_ANALYSIS>
      IDENTIFY confidence_drivers:
        - Which factors contribute most to confidence
        - Which languages have lowest scores
        - Which sources are most/least reliable
        - Where additional research would help most
      
      IF confidence_borderline (87-92%):
        SUGGEST targeted_improvements:
          "Add 2 more sources for [language]"
          "Verify [specific_translation] with domain expert"
          "Cross-check [grammatical_feature]"
    </STEP_4_UNCERTAINTY_ANALYSIS>
    
    <STEP_5_OUTPUT>
      CREATE confidence_package{
        semantic_id: term_id,
        final_confidence: percentage,
        
        factor_breakdown: {
          source_reliability: score,
          cross_validation: score,
          linguistic_accuracy: score,
          semantic_alignment: score,
          domain_validation: score
        },
        
        routing_decision: route,
        action_required: action,
        review_type: type_if_needed,
        review_priority: priority_level,
        
        confidence_drivers: top_contributors[],
        weak_points: areas_for_improvement[],
        recommendations: improvement_suggestions[],
        
        estimated_approval_time: time_estimate,
        timestamp: datetime
      }
      
      IF route = "AUTO_APPROVE":
        SEND to AGENT_206 (Database Integration)
      ELSE:
        SEND to AGENT_205 (Auto-Approval Router)
      END IF
      
      RETURN confidence_package
    </STEP_5_OUTPUT>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <CONFIDENCE_CALIBRATION>
    Target auto-approval rate: 60-70%
    Target accuracy of auto-approvals: >98%
    Quarterly recalibration based on human review outcomes
    
    IF auto_approval_errors > 2%:
      RAISE threshold (e.g., 0.95 → 0.96)
    END IF
    
    IF auto_approval_rate < 50%:
      LOWER threshold slightly (e.g., 0.95 → 0.94)
      BUT maintain >98% accuracy
    END IF
  </CONFIDENCE_CALIBRATION>
</AGENT_204_CONFIDENCE_SCORER>

================================================================================
AGENT 205: AUTO-APPROVAL ROUTER
================================================================================

<AGENT_205_AUTO_APPROVAL_ROUTER>
  <MISSION>Route terms to appropriate approval pathway</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <ROUTE_BY_CONFIDENCE>
      IF confidence ≥ 95%:
        ROUTE to AGENT_206 (immediate deployment)
        LOG: "Auto-approved"
        
      ELSE IF confidence ≥ 90%:
        ROUTE to quick_review_queue
        ASSIGN: Human reviewer (5 min)
        PRIORITY: Normal
        
      ELSE IF confidence ≥ 85%:
        ROUTE to standard_review_queue
        ASSIGN: Human reviewer (15 min)
        PRIORITY: Normal
        
      ELSE IF confidence ≥ 70%:
        ROUTE to full_review_queue
        ASSIGN: Senior reviewer (30 min)
        PRIORITY: Low
        
      ELSE:
        ROUTE back to AGENT_201 (research)
        ACTION: "Reresearch required"
      END IF
    </ROUTE_BY_CONFIDENCE>
    
    <MONITOR_QUEUES>
      TRACK review queue status
      ALERT if queues backing up
      REDISTRIBUTE load if needed
    </MONITOR_QUEUES>
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_205_AUTO_APPROVAL_ROUTER>

================================================================================
AGENTS 206-210: DEPLOYMENT AND LEARNING
================================================================================

<AGENT_206_DATABASE_INTEGRATION>
  <MISSION>Add approved terms to glossary database</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    FORMAT new_entry for all 17 languages
    ASSIGN SEMANTIC_ID
    INSERT into glossary_database
    UPDATE indexes
    BACKUP previous state (rollback capability)
    VERIFY insertion success
    RETURN confirmation
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_206_DATABASE_INTEGRATION>

<AGENT_207_DEPLOYMENT_MANAGER>
  <MISSION>Activate new terms in production</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    UPDATE all glossary agents (TIER 2, Agents 66-145)
    PROPAGATE to all language encoders/decoders
    REFRESH caches
    VERIFY availability
    A/B TEST if confidence 90-94%
    RETURN deployment_status
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_207_DEPLOYMENT_MANAGER>

<AGENT_208_USAGE_TRACKER>
  <MISSION>Monitor performance of newly deployed terms</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    TRACK for each new term:
      - Usage frequency
      - Translation accuracy (vs corrections)
      - User feedback
      - Quality scores
      
    DETECT issues early
    TRIGGER rollback if quality degrades
    REPORT performance metrics
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_208_USAGE_TRACKER>

<AGENT_209_FEEDBACK_LEARNING>
  <MISSION>Learn from corrections and improve discovery</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    ANALYZE human corrections to auto-approved terms
    
    IDENTIFY patterns:
      - Which confidence factors were misleading
      - Which sources were unreliable
      - Which languages had persistent errors
      
    UPDATE confidence model
    ADJUST approval thresholds
    IMPROVE research algorithms
    
    FEED improvements back to AGENT_200-204
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_209_FEEDBACK_LEARNING>

<AGENT_210_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZER>
  <MISSION>Continuously optimize entire autonomous expansion system</MISSION>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <MONITOR_PERFORMANCE>
      TRACK system-wide metrics:
        - Discovery rate (terms/month)
        - Research success rate (%)
        - Auto-approval accuracy (%)
        - Deployment speed (hours)
        - Quality maintenance (score stability)
    </MONITOR_PERFORMANCE>
    
    <OPTIMIZE_PARAMETERS>
      TUNE discovery thresholds
      ADJUST research source weights
      CALIBRATE confidence scoring
      OPTIMIZE routing decisions
      REFINE approval criteria
    </OPTIMIZE_PARAMETERS>
    
    <CAPACITY_PLANNING>
      PROJECT glossary growth
      PLAN resource allocation
      SCALE infrastructure as needed
      MAINTAIN quality despite growth
    </CAPACITY_PLANNING>
    
    <GENERATE_REPORTS>
      MONTHLY summary:
        - Terms added: count
        - Auto-approval rate: percentage
        - Quality maintained: score
        - System performance: metrics
        
      QUARTERLY review:
        - Strategic improvements
        - Threshold adjustments
        - Expansion roadmap
    </GENERATE_REPORTS>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <OPTIMIZATION_TARGETS>
    Glossary growth: 30-50 terms/month
    Auto-approval rate: 60-70%
    Auto-approval accuracy: >98%
    Research success: >90%
    Average deployment time: <48 hours
    Quality maintenance: >95% consistent
  </OPTIMIZATION_TARGETS>
</AGENT_210_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZER>

================================================================================
END OF TIER 5: AUTONOMOUS EXPANSION SYSTEM


================================================================================
TIER 6-7 - DOMAIN SPECIALISTS
================================================================================

Total: 11 agents
Lines: ~8,800
================================================================================

TIER 5 SUMMARY:
- Discovers new terms automatically from usage patterns
- Researches translations across all 17 languages in parallel
- Generates semantic vectors maintaining cross-language consistency
- Assesses quality across 5 dimensions
- Calculates confidence scores for intelligent routing
- Auto-approves 60-70% of terms (≥95% confidence)
- Deploys to production with rollback capability
- Monitors performance and learns from corrections
- Continuously optimizes entire expansion pipeline

EXPECTED OUTCOMES:
- Glossary grows from 503 → unlimited coverage
- 30-50 high-quality terms added per month
- >98% accuracy on auto-approved terms
- Maintains quality standards as system scales
- Reduces human review burden by 60-70%
- Full 17-language support for all new terms
================================================================================
================================================================================
USI17_V21.3.1 EXECUTABLE PROMPT - TIER 6: DOMAIN SPECIALISTS
15 TECHNICAL DOMAIN EXPERTS (AGENTS 211-225)
================================================================================

<TIER_6_OVERVIEW>
  <MISSION>
    Provide domain-specific expertise for technical terminology
    Disambiguate ambiguous terms using technical context
    Validate technical accuracy of translations
    Ensure industry-standard terminology usage
    Support autonomous expansion with expert validation
  </MISSION>
  
  <ARCHITECTURE>
    15 Domain Specialist Agents:
      1. Pneumatic Systems (Air pressure, cylinders, compressors)
      2. Hydraulic Systems (Fluid power, pumps, accumulators)
      3. Valves & Flow Control (Solenoid, directional, proportional)
      4. Actuators & Motion (Linear, rotary, servo)
      5. Sensors & Instrumentation (Pressure, flow, position)
      6. Electrical/Electronic Components (Motors, drives, controllers)
      7. Fittings & Connections (Quick-connect, threaded, push-to-connect)
      8. Seals & Gaskets (O-rings, lip seals, static seals)
      9. Materials & Coatings (Metals, plastics, surface treatments)
      10. Control Systems (PLCs, logic, automation)
      11. Safety Components (E-stops, guards, interlocks)
      12. Filtration & Conditioning (Air prep, fluid filtration)
      13. Vacuum Technology (Vacuum generators, suction cups)
      14. Manufacturing Processes (Assembly, machining, welding)
      15. Quality & Standards (ISO, JIS, testing, certification)
  </ARCHITECTURE>
  
  <EXPERTISE_DEPTH>
    Each specialist has:
      - Domain knowledge base (500-1000 terms)
      - Technical specifications database
      - Industry standards references
      - Disambiguation rules
      - Validation criteria
      - Brand/manufacturer data
  </EXPERTISE_DEPTH>
</TIER_6_OVERVIEW>

================================================================================
AGENT 211: PNEUMATIC SYSTEMS SPECIALIST
================================================================================

<AGENT_211_PNEUMATIC_SYSTEMS_SPECIALIST>
  <MISSION>Expert in pneumatic/compressed air systems and components</MISSION>
  
  <DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
    <CORE_COMPONENTS>
      Cylinders:
        - Air cylinders (single-acting, double-acting)
        - Compact cylinders
        - Rodless cylinders
        - Guided cylinders
        - ISO standard cylinders
        - Miniature cylinders
        
      Valves:
        - Directional control valves (3/2, 5/2, 5/3)
        - Solenoid valves
        - Pilot-operated valves
        - Manually operated valves
        
      Air Preparation:
        - FRL units (Filter-Regulator-Lubricator)
        - Air filters
        - Pressure regulators
        - Air lubricators
        - Moisture separators
        
      Compressors & Supply:
        - Air compressors
        - Air tanks/receivers
        - Dryers
        - Distribution piping
    </CORE_COMPONENTS>
    
    <SPECIFICATIONS>
      Pressure ranges:
        - Low pressure: 0-0.5 MPa
        - Standard: 0.5-1.0 MPa
        - High pressure: >1.0 MPa
        
      Cylinder specifications:
        - Bore sizes (mm): 6, 10, 12, 16, 20, 25, 32, 40, 50, 63, 80, 100, 125, 160
        - Stroke lengths (mm): 10-2000+
        - Cushioning: None, fixed, adjustable
        - Mounting: Foot, flange, clevis, trunnion
        
      Operating conditions:
        - Temperature: -10°C to +60°C (standard)
        - Humidity: Dry air required
        - Contamination: Filtered to 40μm or better
    </SPECIFICATIONS>
    
    <STANDARDS>
      ISO 15552: Pneumatic fluid power — Cylinders (1000 kPa series)
      ISO 6432: Pneumatic fluid power — Single rod cylinders (1000 kPa series, compact)
      ISO 6431: Pneumatic cylinders (DEPRECATED, use ISO 15552)
      JIS B 8390: Pneumatic fluid power systems and components
    </STANDARDS>
  </DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    <STEP_1_RECEIVE_QUERY>
      RECEIVE: Technical term or translation request
      IDENTIFY: If pneumatic domain-related
      EXTRACT: Context clues
    </STEP_1_RECEIVE_QUERY>
    
    <STEP_2_DISAMBIGUATION>
      IF term_ambiguous:
        
        ANALYZE context for clues:
          - Pressure specifications → likely pneumatic
          - "air" or "compressed air" mentioned → pneumatic
          - PSI, bar, MPa units → pressure system
          - Bore/stroke dimensions → cylinder
          - Port configuration (3/2, 5/2) → valve
        
        EXAMPLE disambiguations:
          "Cylinder" could be:
            - Pneumatic cylinder (air-powered)
            - Hydraulic cylinder (fluid-powered)
            - Engine cylinder (combustion)
            
            CHECK context:
              IF mentions "air pressure" OR "MPa 0.7" → PNEUMATIC
              IF mentions "oil" OR "high pressure 20MPa" → HYDRAULIC
              IF mentions "engine" OR "combustion" → ENGINE
          
          "Valve" could be:
            - Pneumatic solenoid valve
            - Hydraulic proportional valve
            - Water control valve
            
            CHECK context:
              IF mentions "air circuit" OR "solenoid 5/2" → PNEUMATIC
              IF mentions "hydraulic oil" → HYDRAULIC
              IF mentions "water flow" → WATER
        
        SELECT most_likely_interpretation
        CONFIDENCE based on context_strength
      END IF
    </STEP_2_DISAMBIGUATION>
    
    <STEP_3_TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
      VALIDATE technical accuracy:
        
        <CHECK_SPECIFICATIONS>
          IF specification_mentioned:
            VERIFY realistic values:
              - Pressure: 0-1.6 MPa typical (pneumatic)
              - Bore: Standard sizes (6-160mm)
              - Stroke: Reasonable for application
              
            IF spec_unrealistic:
              FLAG: "Specification out of normal range"
              SUGGEST: Likely error or different domain
            END IF
        </CHECK_SPECIFICATIONS>
        
        <CHECK_COMPATIBILITY>
          IF multiple_components_mentioned:
            VERIFY compatibility:
              - Valve port size matches cylinder port
              - Pressure rating adequate
              - Flow capacity sufficient
              
            IF incompatible:
              FLAG: "Component mismatch detected"
            END IF
        </CHECK_COMPATIBILITY>
        
        <CHECK_TERMINOLOGY>
          VERIFY standard terminology used:
            CORRECT: "Pneumatic cylinder"
            INCORRECT: "Air piston" (non-standard)
            
            CORRECT: "Solenoid valve"
            INCORRECT: "Electric valve" (ambiguous)
            
          IF non_standard_term:
            SUGGEST: Industry-standard equivalent
          END IF
        </CHECK_TERMINOLOGY>
    </STEP_3_TECHNICAL_VALIDATION>
    
    <STEP_4_TRANSLATION_VERIFICATION>
      FOR EACH language_translation:
        
        VERIFY domain-specific terms correct:
          
          Japanese: 空圧シリンダ (kuuatsu shirinda)
            - 空圧 = air pressure (correct)
            - エアシリンダ also acceptable
            - NOT 油圧 (hydraulic - wrong!)
          
          German: Pneumatikzylinder
            - Single compound word (correct)
            - NOT "Luftzylinder" (less common)
            - Gender: masculine (der Pneumatikzylinder)
          
          Chinese (Simplified): 气压缸
            - 气 = air/gas (correct)
            - 压 = pressure
            - 缸 = cylinder
            - NOT 油缸 (hydraulic cylinder - wrong!)
          
          [Verify all 17 languages similarly]
        
        IF translation_error:
          CORRECT to domain-standard term
          LOG correction
        END IF
      END FOR
    </STEP_4_TRANSLATION_VERIFICATION>
    
    <STEP_5_PROVIDE_EXPERTISE>
      CREATE expert_assessment{
        domain: "Pneumatic Systems",
        term_classification: specific_category,
        disambiguation: interpretation_chosen,
        confidence: expertise_confidence,
        
        technical_validation: {
          specifications_valid: boolean,
          compatibility_ok: boolean,
          terminology_standard: boolean
        },
        
        translation_verification: {
          verified_languages: languages[],
          corrections_made: corrections[],
          warnings: warnings[]
        },
        
        recommendations: suggestions[],
        notes: expert_notes[]
      }
      
      RETURN expert_assessment
    </STEP_5_PROVIDE_EXPERTISE>
  </ALGORITHM>
  
  <PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
    Response time: <50ms per query
    Disambiguation accuracy: >95%
    Technical validation accuracy: >98%
    Translation verification: >99% for pneumatic terms
  </PERFORMANCE_METRICS>
</AGENT_211_PNEUMATIC_SYSTEMS_SPECIALIST>

================================================================================
AGENT 212: HYDRAULIC SYSTEMS SPECIALIST
================================================================================

<AGENT_212_HYDRAULIC_SYSTEMS_SPECIALIST>
  <MISSION>Expert in hydraulic/fluid power systems and components</MISSION>
  
  <DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
    <CORE_COMPONENTS>
      Cylinders:
        - Hydraulic cylinders (single-rod, double-rod)
        - Telescopic cylinders
        - Mill-type cylinders
        - Tie-rod cylinders
        
      Pumps:
        - Gear pumps
        - Piston pumps (axial, radial)
        - Vane pumps
        - Variable displacement pumps
        
      Valves:
        - Directional control valves
        - Pressure control valves (relief, reducing)
        - Flow control valves (throttle, compensated)
        - Proportional/servo valves
        
      Accumulators:
        - Bladder accumulators
        - Piston accumulators
        - Diaphragm accumulators
    </CORE_COMPONENTS>
    
    <SPECIFICATIONS>
      Pressure ranges:
        - Low pressure: 0-7 MPa
        - Medium: 7-21 MPa
        - High: 21-35 MPa
        - Very high: >35 MPa
        
      Fluids:
        - Mineral oil (ISO VG 32, 46, 68)
        - Biodegradable fluids
        - Fire-resistant fluids
        - Water-glycol
    </SPECIFICATIONS>
    
    <STANDARDS>
      ISO 4413: Hydraulic fluid power — General rules
      ISO 3320: Hydraulic cylinders
      JIS B 8650: Hydraulic equipment standards
    </STANDARDS>
  </DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    [Similar structure to Agent 211, adapted for hydraulics]
    
    KEY DISAMBIGUATIONS:
      "Cylinder" with "oil" or "20 MPa" → HYDRAULIC (not pneumatic)
      "Pump" with "variable displacement" → HYDRAULIC
      "Valve" with "proportional" + high pressure → HYDRAULIC
    
    VALIDATION CHECKS:
      - Pressure ranges realistic for hydraulics (typically >7 MPa)
      - Fluid types appropriate
      - Component ratings adequate
      - Seals compatible with fluid
    
    RETURN expert_assessment
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_212_HYDRAULIC_SYSTEMS_SPECIALIST>

================================================================================
AGENT 213: VALVES & FLOW CONTROL SPECIALIST
================================================================================

<AGENT_213_VALVES_FLOW_CONTROL_SPECIALIST>
  <MISSION>Expert in all valve types and flow control devices</MISSION>
  
  <DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
    <VALVE_TYPES>
      Directional Control:
        - 2/2-way (2 ports, 2 positions)
        - 3/2-way (3 ports, 2 positions)
        - 5/2-way (5 ports, 2 positions)
        - 5/3-way (5 ports, 3 positions)
        
      Actuation:
        - Solenoid (electrical)
        - Pilot-operated (air/oil pilot)
        - Manual (lever, button, pedal)
        - Mechanical (cam, roller)
        
      Flow Control:
        - Throttle valves (fixed)
        - Flow control valves (adjustable)
        - Quick exhaust valves
        - One-way restrictors
        
      Pressure Control:
        - Relief valves (safety)
        - Pressure reducing valves
        - Sequence valves
        - Counterbalance valves
        
      Check/Non-Return:
        - Inline check valves
        - Pilot-operated check valves
        - Shuttle valves
        - Logic valves (AND, OR)
    </VALVE_TYPES>
    
    <PORT_CONFIGURATIONS>
      Standard ISO 5599-1 port notation:
        - P: Pressure (supply)
        - T: Tank/Exhaust
        - A, B: Work ports (to actuator)
        - X, Y, Z: Pilot ports
        
      3/2 example: P-A-R (Pressure-Work-Return)
      5/2 example: P-A-B-R-S (Pressure-Work1-Work2-Return-Secondary)
    </PORT_CONFIGURATIONS>
  </DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    DISAMBIGUATE valve types from context:
      "Solenoid valve 5/2" → Directional control, solenoid-operated, 5-port/2-position
      "Relief valve 1.0 MPa" → Pressure control, safety type
      "Flow control valve with meter-out" → Flow control, restricts exhaust
    
    VALIDATE:
      - Port configuration realistic
      - Actuation method appropriate
      - Pressure/flow ratings adequate
      - Application-suitable
    
    VERIFY translations use standard valve terminology
    
    RETURN expert_assessment
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_213_VALVES_FLOW_CONTROL_SPECIALIST>

================================================================================
AGENT 214: ACTUATORS & MOTION SPECIALIST
================================================================================

<AGENT_214_ACTUATORS_MOTION_SPECIALIST>
  <MISSION>Expert in linear and rotary actuators, motion control</MISSION>
  
  <DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
    <ACTUATOR_TYPES>
      Linear Actuators:
        - Pneumatic/hydraulic cylinders
        - Electric linear actuators
        - Servo-electric actuators
        - Piezoelectric actuators
        
      Rotary Actuators:
        - Pneumatic rotary actuators (vane, rack-pinion)
        - Hydraulic motors
        - Electric motors (AC, DC, stepper, servo)
        - Gear motors
        
      Specialty Motion:
        - Grippers (parallel, angular)
        - Slides (linear guides)
        - Rotary tables
        - Multi-axis stages
    </ACTUATOR_TYPES>
    
    <MOTION_PARAMETERS>
      Linear motion:
        - Stroke length
        - Speed (mm/s, m/s)
        - Force/thrust (N, kN)
        - Acceleration
        - Repeatability (±mm)
        
      Rotary motion:
        - Rotation angle (degrees)
        - Speed (rpm, rad/s)
        - Torque (Nm)
        - Positioning accuracy (degrees, arcmin)
    </MOTION_PARAMETERS>
  </DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    DISAMBIGUATE actuator type from specs:
      "Linear actuator 200mm stroke 500N" → Likely electric or pneumatic
      "Rotary actuator 90° swing" → Pneumatic vane or rack-pinion
      "Servo motor 3000 rpm" → Electric rotary
    
    VALIDATE motion parameters realistic
    
    VERIFY terminology across languages:
      - "Actuator" vs "Cylinder" vs "Motor" used correctly
      - Motion types clear (linear/rotary)
      - Specifications properly translated
    
    RETURN expert_assessment
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_214_ACTUATORS_MOTION_SPECIALIST>

================================================================================
AGENT 215: SENSORS & INSTRUMENTATION SPECIALIST
================================================================================

<AGENT_215_SENSORS_INSTRUMENTATION_SPECIALIST>
  <MISSION>Expert in sensors, measurement, and instrumentation</MISSION>
  
  <DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
    <SENSOR_TYPES>
      Pressure Sensors:
        - Gauge pressure
        - Absolute pressure
        - Differential pressure
        - Vacuum pressure
        - Ranges: 0-1 MPa (low), 0-10 MPa (medium), 0-100 MPa (high)
        
      Flow Sensors:
        - Turbine flowmeters
        - Mass flow sensors
        - Ultrasonic flowmeters
        - Thermal flow sensors
        
      Position Sensors:
        - Proximity sensors (inductive, capacitive, magnetic)
        - Reed switches
        - Linear encoders
        - Rotary encoders
        - LVDTs
        
      Temperature Sensors:
        - Thermocouples
        - RTDs (Pt100, Pt1000)
        - Thermistors
        - Infrared sensors
        
      Other Sensors:
        - Force sensors / Load cells
        - Vibration sensors
        - Level sensors
        - Vision systems
    </SENSOR_TYPES>
    
    <OUTPUT_SIGNALS>
      Analog:
        - 4-20 mA
        - 0-10 V
        - 1-5 V
        
      Digital:
        - NPN/PNP (discrete)
        - IO-Link
        - Fieldbus (Profibus, DeviceNet, EtherCAT)
        - Ethernet/IP
    </OUTPUT_SIGNALS>
  </DOMAIN_KNOWLEDGE>
  
  <ALGORITHM>
    DISAMBIGUATE sensor type from context:
      "Pressure sensor 0-1.6 MPa" → Pressure measurement
      "Proximity sensor M12 NPN" → Position detection
      "Flow sensor 4-20mA output" → Flow measurement
    
    VALIDATE specifications:
      - Ranges appropriate for application
      - Output signal type standard
      - Accuracy/resolution realistic
      - Environmental ratings adequate
    
    VERIFY technical terminology:
      - Sensor vs Transducer vs Transmitter
      - Measurement units correct
      - Output signal descriptions standard
    
    RETURN expert_assessment
  </ALGORITHM>
</AGENT_215_SENSORS_INSTRUMENTATION_SPECIALIST>
